item.title: Authenticate with a Cloudflare API key
item.description: Authenticate with a Cloudflare API keyAPI keys are unique to each Cloudflare user and used only for authentication. An API key does not authorize access to accounts or zones. To ensure that the GraphQL Analytics API authenticates your queries, retrieve your Cloudflare Global API Key. Learn how to retrieve your API Key in the Cloudflare dashboard External link icon Open external link . Learn how to retrieve your API Key using the Cloudflare API.

item.title: Configure GraphQL client endpoint and HTTP headers
item.description: Configure GraphQL client endpoint and HTTP headers Launch GraphiQL External link icon Open external link . Click Edit HTTP Headers. The Edit HTTP Headers window appears. Click Add Header. Enter X-AUTH-EMAIL in the Header name field and your email address registered with Cloudflare in the Header value field, and click Save. To configure authentication, click Add Header. You can use Cloudflare Analytics API token authentication (recommended) or Cloudflare API key authentication.
